quote: What loneliness is more lonely than distrust?
Anger is a manifestation of a deeper issue... and that, for me, is based on insecurity, self-esteem and loneliness.
At the innermost core of all loneliness is a deep and powerful yearning for union with one's lost self.
Fame always brings loneliness. Success is as ice cold and lonely as the North Pole.
If you are afraid of loneliness, don't marry.
Life is full of misery, loneliness, and suffering - and it's all over much too soon.
Life is full of misery, loneliness, and suffering - and it's all over much too soon.
Loneliness and the feeling of being unwanted is the most terrible poverty.
Loneliness and the feeling of being unwanted is the most terrible poverty.
What loneliness is more lonely than distrust?

If you are afraid of loneliness, don't marry.
Life is full of misery, loneliness, and suffering - and it's all over much too soon.
Life is full of misery, loneliness, and suffering - and it's all over much too soon.

Loneliness and the feeling of being unwanted is the most terrible poverty.
Loneliness is never more cruel than when it is felt in close propinquity with someone who has ceased to communicate.
Loneliness is painful when one is young, but delightful when one is mature.
Loneliness is the ultimate poverty.
Loneliness, insomnia, and change: the fear of these is even worse than the reality.
Man's loneliness is but his fear of life.
Moon! Moon! am prone before you. Pity me, and drench me in loneliness.
Music was invented to confirm human loneliness.
No one ever discovers the depths of his own loneliness.
One cat in a house is a sign of loneliness, two of barrenness, and three of sodomy.
Pray that your loneliness may spur you into finding something to live for, great enough to die for.
Skillful listening is the best remedy for loneliness, loquaciousness, and laryngitis.
The dread of loneliness is greater than the fear of bondage, so we get married.
The essence of this man [Richard M. Nixon] is loneliness.
The eternal quest of the human being is to shatter his loneliness.
The surest cure for vanity is loneliness.
The surest sign of age is loneliness.
There is no loneliness greater than the loneliness of a failure. The failure is a stranger in his own house.
There is no loneliness like that of a failed marriage.
We are all so much together, but we are all dying of loneliness.
